intro: Erigeron scabrellus, commonly known as the rough fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are usually hairy and rough to the touch, giving the plant its common name.
